content.description: Start on crack with tree growing in it or just left of it. Gain the first easy bulges (5.5?), move left, then pull the crux move (easier if you're taller) over the next bulge. Easier climbing to the anchor. I'm terrible at grades so please speak up if this is way off and/or if you know the route name.
content.protection: Two anchor bolts with hangers in great condition.
content.location: Face climb that is almost directly in front of the tree.

content.description: Starts on a liebacking flake and moving up and slightly left, Â you'll come to a bulge that is easier to get up and over by moving right, but if you stay left of the jugs it'll make it a little more challenging and fun! After the bulge it gets easier to the anchors.
content.protection: Two anchor bolts with hangers, one hanger moves ever so slightly when tested,  but I felt it was definitely still in good functioning condition with no need for immediate attention.
content.location: Start is on a flake on the right hand side of the crag, see photo.

content.description: Low angle slab on the left side of the crag. Good for kiddos and practicing rappelling.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor at the top with hangers in great condition .
content.location: Obvious low angle on the left side of the formation.
